speakers.name: Daniel Ellsberg
speakers.description: Danniel Ellsberg is a former US military analyst, author, and activist. Mr. Ellsberg famously leaked the Pentagon Papers to The New York Times in 1971, revealing the systematic deception of four presidencies.

speakers.name: Jennifer Granick
speakers.description: Jennifer Granick is Director of Civil Liberties for the Center for Internet and Society at Stanford Law School. Jennifer Granick has written extensively about NSA surveillance, including a recent piece in the New York Times.

speakers.name: Mark Klein
speakers.description: Mark Klein is the AT&T/NSA whistleblower who revealed in 2006 that AT&T was secretly cooperating with the NSA to divert communications to the intelligence agency, leading to the Hepting v. AT&T lawsuit.

speakers.name: Norman Solomon
speakers.description: Norman Soloman is an author journalist, politician, media critic and founder of the Institute for Public Accuracy.

speakers.name: Cullen Hoback
speakers.description: Cullen Hoback is Director of 'Terms and Conditions May Apply', a documentary exploring the loss of online privacy.
